clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Aerobic Exercise in Microvascular Endothelium Function in Patients With Cardiovascular Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Aerobic Exercise Training in Patients With Cardiovascular Diseases Related to Microvascular Endothelium Function, Angiogenesis, Oxidative Stress and Aerobic Capacity

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto Nacional de Cardiologia de Laranjeiras

clinical_study.source: Instituto Nacional de Cardiologia de Laranjeiras

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effects of different volumes of aerobic exercise training in cardiovascular parameters of patients with cardiovascular diseases enrolled in a cardiac rehabilitation program.

detailed_description.textblock: Aerobic exercise training is well known to improve endothelium dependent vasodilatation in the microcirculation. However, the impact of exercise frequency on this response in patients with coronary artery disease remains unclear.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Skin microvascular blood flow
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in skin microvascular blood flow at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Measured through a Laser Speckle Contrast Imaging equipment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in peak oxygen consumption at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured at a maximal graded exercise test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline in weight at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with a calibrated digital scale

arm_group.description: This group will be consisted of patients that will perform exercise two times a week.
This group will be consisted of patients that will perform exercise three times a week.
This group will not perform exercise.

intervention.description: Patients included in the study will be enrolled in a cardiac rehabilitation program, in an independent manner of the study protocols.

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated in the hospital in which the exercise will be performed.
